entry.title: Evangaline Buckley Begins
entry.summary:
Author: Not_Ren_42

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,234Chapters: 7/12Kudos: 34

Summary: Evangaline Buckley has been alone for most of her life. She was unwanted by her parents and left by her sister when she had the first chance. For her most formative years, she had to go to extreme lengths just to get attention from those meant to care for her, failing more often than not.After finding out the truth about her creation, Evie decides that she has to do something – anything. She goes through even more pain and heartbreak before finding herself where she was always meant to end up. (Chapter 1 has been rewritten)

entry.title: The Family We Chose
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,762Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 171

Summary: Evan Buckley was truly fucked. One week after leaving the only home he’d ever known—his parents’ house—Ground Zero hit, and the world went to hell. Eight months later, he’s still searching for his sister Maddie in Los Angeles, armed only with a tear-stained note: “I’m leaving Doug. I’m going to Los Angeles.” When Buck finally tracks her to Safe Zone 118, he realizes that maybe having a family—and surviving alongside people who actually care—isn’t so bad. At 118, firefighter Eddie Diaz, a single dad, turned his fire station into a refuge with his team when Ground Zero struck. Just trying to keep his kids safe, he’s thrown for a loop when a stranger shows up claiming to be Maddie’s brother. Buck is skilled, prepared, and oddly magnetic—forcing Eddie to question everything he thought he knew about survival, trust, and maybe even… something more.

entry.title: courage tastes like him
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,019Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: Buck’s jaw clenches. “This isn’t you.” Eddie’s smile turns mean, borderline unrecognizable even to himself. Buck is right, this isn’t him. It doesn’t even sound like his voice. But he’s exhausted. He’s hurt. And he’s done pretending there’s a way out of this that doesn’t involve blood in the water—they’re too far gone for that. This wasn’t the plan, but he doesn’t pull back from the fight. He doubles down, clinging to the belief that devastation is better than emptiness, that being hated is better than being erased. “Funny,” Eddie says softly. “Is that what you tell yourself when you fuck anyone who’ll have you? That it doesn’t mean anything? That it’s easier than admitting you’re trying not to think about me?” Or,Eddie figures his shit out. Eventually.

entry.title: I know they're losing (and I'll pay for my place by the ring)
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,722Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 31

Summary: It started as an outlet, at first. A way to let out his anger in a controlled manner, with a willing opponent who would offer him the pain that he deserved. He felt itchy. Teen pregnancy in a Catholic household had cloaked him with such a thick layer of shame that he needed a way to forget. It was a good thing, he tells himself. It was an honest thing - born out of good intentions. Until it wasn't. - Or Instead of enlisting in the military, Eddie makes money via an underground fight club in Texas. After threats against his family are leveled, Eddie finds a way to Los Angeles with the help of Athena Grant. Now working as private security, he begins working for Evan "Buck" Buckley, an arrogant and hot-headed singer/songwriter who may just give Eddie Diaz a run for his money.   title based on I Bet On Losing Dogs by Mitski

entry.title: Bucks struggle
entry.summary:
Author: Waffle_pancake77

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,068Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 46

Summary: Eddie calls him about an hour after we got off asking to hang out at his place. “Hey Buck, do you want to come over and watch this new movie Christopher was talking about? He says it’s really cool. I got beer.” Which was nice because he don’t have internet or anything to drink but some good ol tap water. “Yeah sure. I’d love to.” He says trying to stay calm but I’m so excited I haven’t watched tv in who knows how long. “When do you want me to head over?” He asks with a huge smile over the phone. He’s not sure why he’s so excited, maybe it’s because he gets to see them, maybe he’s because Eddie has internet, maybe its because he has more then tap water (which is just gross) to drink. Maybe it’s all of those reasons. He laughs into the phone, “Now, if you want to.” —or Buck is broke and just trying to figure it out.

entry.title: after the lightning
entry.summary:
Author: softlightstills

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,913Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 14

Summary: The machines keep in time in a language Eddie doesn't want to understand. Beeps and hisses and the mechanical rise and fall of each breath that isn't really breathing. Three weeks becomes five becomes eight becomes a decision no one should have to make. Eddie had spent his whole life learning how to survive impossible things. He survived war, survived loss, survived being shot in the street. But this, watching Buck slip further away with each passing day, holding onto hope that grows thinner with every doctor's gentle explanation. This might be the thing that finally breaks him. Some words are easier left unsaid. Some truths are safer kept locked away. Eddie had always told himself there would be time later, that some confessions could wait for the right moment, the right words, the right courage. He was wrong.

entry.title: Remember, darling, don't smoke in bed
entry.summary:
Author: buckmeetsboy

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,435Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 132

Summary: Buck blinks. “You mean smoking?” “No! I mean—yes. I mean—Jesus, Buck, do you know what you look like?” Buck tilts his head the other way, which is even worse, somehow. “What exactly is this about…?” “It’s about the fact that you smoke like it’s porn.” Buck stares. Eddie throws up his hands. “You smoke like it’s foreplay, okay?! I can’t—Jesus—I can’t think when you do it.” Buck’s expression does a strange thing. It falters, shifts, and then slides into something dangerous. "Wait,” Buck says, slow and low, “are you saying you’re into it?”   Or Eddie is really into Buck's new habit

entry.title: the thoughts of hell that carry me home
entry.summary:
Author: dante_kent

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,537Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 65

Summary: He should be glad of it. He doesn’t want people to know he’s struggling, and they don’t. But why doesn’t Buck know? He’s always known, always seen through Eddie’s carefully constructed walls and carved himself a door into them. Even when Eddie resisted, even when he pushed back, Buck ducked his head and shoved through and found the tender hurt Eddie was guarding, cupped his hands around it and held until it didn’t ache so much. And now Eddie’s bleeding internally, swollen with regret, and Buck doesn’t say a thing. Eddie can’t ask him to. If he opens his mouth, he might just start screaming. ~ There's distance between Eddie and Buck. Eddie isn't falling apart. These are two equally true statements.

  • Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Evan "Buck" Buckley/Eddie Diaz (9-1-1 TV)

  • they will be ok. happy even. but i have to put them through it first

entry.title: shelter here with me, my love
entry.summary:
Author: instantcaramel

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,140Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 45

Summary: By the time Buck is thirty-one, he’s one of the most popular players in the entire NHL. He’s taken his team to the playoffs almost every year, and they’ve even made the Western Conference Finals a few times.He knows he only has so many years left. He’s had some pretty rough injuries, and he’s had a string of failed relationships to go with them. He’s starting to come to terms with the fact that, actually, hockey isn’t just something he loves - it’s probably the love of his life. He’s trying to be fine with that fact.

entry.title: A Year Of You And Me
entry.summary:
Author: LibbyWrites

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,823Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 20

Summary: In spite of his skepticism, Eddie decides to start journaling, following his therapist's advice. The man gives him a list of 365 prompts and questions to write about each day, to help him untangle the mess his brain has become. Under the knots, he might find much more than just peace of mind.
